title: Overview • Docs • Svelte
content:
The Svelte command-line interface (CLI), `sv`, is a toolkit for creating and maintaining Svelte applications.

The easiest way to run `sv` is with `npx` (or your package manager's equivalent, such as `pnpx` for pnpm):

```bash
npx sv <command> <args>
```

If `sv` is already installed in your project, this will use the local installation; otherwise, it will download the latest version and run it without installing it globally. This is particularly useful for `sv create`.

Acknowledgements:

Thank you to Christopher Brown, who originally owned the `sv` name on npm, for graciously allowing its use for the Svelte CLI. You can find the original `sv` package at `@chbrown/sv`.
